oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Effects of spin-orbit coupling and spatial symmetries on the Josephson current in SNS junctions
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Rasmussen, Asbjørn
Danon, Jeroen
Suominen, Henri
Nichele, Fabrizio
Kjaergaard, Morten
Flensberg, Karsten
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Condensed Matter - Mesoscale and Nanoscale Physics
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We present an analysis of the symmetries of the interference pattern of critical currents through a two-dimensional superconductor-semiconductor-superconductor junction, taking into account Rashba and Dresselhaus spin-orbit interaction, an arbitrarily oriented magnetic field, disorder, and structural asymmetries. We relate the symmetries of the pattern to the absence or presence of symmetries in the Hamiltonian, which provides a qualitative connection between easily measurable quantities and the spin-orbit coupling and other symmetries of the junction. We support our analysis with numerical calculations of the Josephson current based on a perturbative expansion up to eighth order in tunnel coupling between the normal region and the superconductors.
